pr_title: Convert array elements to proper representation

timeline.message:
Use literal expected values in TestJdbcCompatibility

Remove `roundedTimestamp` used for computing expected values, replacing
it with explicit expected values.

Remove excessive use of String.valueOf in ResultSet

In all changed places the type of the value is known, so its client
representation is known too.

Fix TIME/TIMESTAMP TZ column declaration for result set

This makes the `ResultSetMetaData` metadata consistent with
`java.sql.DatabaseMetaData#getColumns` (as implemented in
`io.prestosql.connector.system.jdbc.ColumnJdbcTable#jdbcDataType`).
Add test for SQL Array element type introspection

Use AssertJ for comparing arrays

TestNG's `Assert.assertEquals` behavior to print array toString when
values do not match is not useful.

Define type conversions in terms of source type name

Keying conversions by source class is not sufficient. Different SQL
types having same client representation (e.g. `String`) need to be
handled separately.
Add runtime type checks when invoking type conversion
Unify ResultSet.getObject logic with type conversions
Convert array elements to proper representation

timeline.bodyText: Use literal expected values in TestJdbcCompatibility LGTM
timeline.author: losipiuk

timeline.bodyText: Fix TIME/TIMESTAMP TZ column declaration for result set is backward incompatible. Do we care?
timeline.author: losipiuk

replies.bodyText: Yes, it is. I think it's just a bug. I reported this as #6251 for reference.
replies.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText:
can you mechanically change other assertEquals to assertThat.equalsTo?
A thought - if we want such migration maybe we should create a series of good-first-issue issues to migrate individual modules.
timeline.author: losipiuk

replies.bodyText: Let's treat this as a follow up, ok? please file appropriate issues, if we want to go into that direction
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: Sure - let's discuss offline if that is direction to go.
replies.author: losipiuk

timeline.bodyText: can you replace resultTimeZone field with constant and reference the constant also here?
timeline.author: losipiuk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -125,10 +125,36 @@
     // Since January 1, 1900 UTC is still December 31, 1899 in other zones, we are adding a 1 year margin.
     private static final long START_OF_MODERN_ERA_SECONDS = java.time.LocalDate.of(1901, 1, 1).toEpochDay() * SECONDS_PER_DAY;
 
-    private static final TypeConversions TYPE_CONVERSIONS =
+    @VisibleForTesting
+    static final Map<String, Class<?>> DEFAULT_OBJECT_REPRESENTATION = ImmutableMap.<String, Class<?>>builder()
+            .put("decimal", BigDecimal.class)
+            .put("date", java.sql.Date.class)
+            .put("time", java.sql.Time.class)
+            .put("time with time zone", java.sql.Time.class)
+            .put("timestamp", java.sql.Timestamp.class)
+            .put("timestamp with time zone", java.sql.Timestamp.class)
+            .put("interval year to month", PrestoIntervalYearMonth.class)
+            .put("interval day to second", PrestoIntervalDayTime.class)
+            .put("map", Map.class)
+            .put("row", Row.class)
+            .build();
+
+    @VisibleForTesting
+    static final TypeConversions TYPE_CONVERSIONS =
             TypeConversions.builder()
-                    .add("array", PrestoArray.class, List.class, array -> asList((Object[]) array.getArray()))
-                    .add("row", Row.class, Map.class, row -> {
+                    .add("decimal", String.class, BigDecimal.class, AbstractPrestoResultSet::parseBigDecimal)
+                    .add("date", String.class, Date.class, string -> parseDate(string, DateTimeZone.forID(ZoneId.systemDefault().getId())))

replies.bodyText: resultTimeZone should not be constant because JVM time zone is settable
replies.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: is the "else" code path needed only for "plugin types" ?
timeline.author: losipiuk

replies.bodyText: No, i did not cover all the builtin types
replies.author: findepi
